comment.author: 80878055@N00
comment._content: Location is west door of St. Patrick's Church of Ireland cathedral, Armagh.

comment.author: 51964676@N00
comment._content: The flag is the King's Colour of one of the local regiments, which was "laid up" in the cathedral after it was retired from service- it's probably still hanging in there somewhere. If the G is George III, this could well have been carried at Waterloo- no wonder it's a bit battered!
